meanings.sent1: The busses arrived at the station on time.
meanings.sent2: I saw many busses on the road during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The busses seemed to be chatting with each other in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The line of busses resembled a colorful caterpillar winding through the city streets.
meanings.sent5: The yellow school busses filled the children with excitement every morning.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of bus
meanings.sent1: She busses to work every day.
meanings.sent2: He busses passengers around the city in his taxi.
meanings.sent3: The cat busses lazily in the warm sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The wind busses through the trees, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully busses the tables after each meal service.

meanings.sent1: The loud busses on her cheek made her giggle.
meanings.sent2: The affectionate busses from the puppy were heartwarming.
meanings.sent3: The playful busses of the children filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The gentle busses of the breeze carried the scent of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected busses of the raindrops woke her up with a smile.
